utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi I'm coming in because I've had this like on and off runny nose and stuffy nose for the past week. Um and I just came to make sure it's not something serious like Covid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah no I completely understand why you might be worried um with everything going on. So just to get an idea of the timeline, so when did this start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So it started about I'd say, seven days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Seven days ago, OK. And was it just a runny nose that started or did you have any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So at first I felt kind of stuffy um and then now it's more runny. Um and no other symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And are you coughing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Are you bringing up any discharge from like your nose, or are you coughing any material up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no. I mean there's some discharge from my nose, like it's runny, but it's it's not yellow or anything, it's clear.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you think this issue has gone worse over the last seven days or is it improving at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I don't think it's improving. It's changed 'cause it used to be stuffy, now it's more of a runny nose. Um but yeah, it seems to be runny, like it's the same amount of runniness for the past couple of days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And are you having any symptoms of loss of smell at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no loss of smell.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about loss of taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um were you uh with anyone around you sick at all before those seven days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I don't think so, I visited my sister and she has a nephew who goes to daycare, but my nephew's been OK, no, no runny nose or stuffy nose.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uhm, and is it just a constant issue that goes on throughout the day or is it worse at night, during the day, how would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um it's it's pretty constant throughout the day. It's just it just feels bad at night because it um makes it hard for me to fall asleep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh have you tried any medications at all over the counter that would help?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I tried some antihistamines because I do have seasonal allergies. Uh but they don't seem to be helping.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um any anything that makes your symptoms worse at all, like any exertion or any kind of uh position?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um do you have any shortness of breath or chest pain at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any sore throat or muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any uh headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you traveled at all recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any night sweats or fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um any kind of sensation that your heart is racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your bowel movements like any constipation or diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes in your urinary pattern?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh any issues with your sleep or appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you lost any weight, significant weight, uh recently in the last few months?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And uh do you have any exposure to like fumes, dust, or like uh carpet, pets, or animals? Anything that you might have an allergic reaction to?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and currently are you sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I am.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And um can you just tell me a little a little bit of a detail like about like a partner? Uh and if you've had any new partners recently at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been with the same partner for the past five years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh do you have any history of any STI's?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK nice, um, in terms of your uh past medical history, do you have any um diagnoses or anything any medical conditions at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm no, no nothing, nothing long standing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um anything you take medications for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Are you allergic to any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh not medications.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh any environmental allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just yeah, some seasonal allergies.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any previous hospitalizations or surgeries?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I was hospitalized for um Like an appendectomy when I was younger. Um but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And when was that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That was when I was 18.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And any complications after that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And uh in terms of your family history, does anyone have any lung conditions, heart conditions, or any cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh nope, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And currently uh do you work?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do. I work from home though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how would you describe your living situation right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I live in an apartment with um my partner and we have a dog.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um and currently, uh do you smoke at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about uh any alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I drink like a glass of wine every other day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um yeah, so those were some of the questions I had for you. I know it's a bit concerning because of the pandemic going on and um a runny nose can be a symptom uh of Covid as well, but uh it can also be a symptom of just the common cold or any other virus. Um but since you're having, uh you're symptomatic right now, we will definitely get like a Covid swab test done for you.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And if you start having any, just monitor for your symptoms. Um you should have the test back within 48 hours. Until then, uh at least for 14 days you should try to isolate in your own room, wear a mask around uh your partner, uh and not go outside, so just self isolate.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And and then you will get the test results back in a, hopefully in a few days. So do you have any questions at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, thank you, that was good.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Take care, bye

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
